com.risk.ui

Class EditMapUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.risk.ui.EditMapUI

  • public class EditMapUI
extends java.lang.Object

    Controller Class for Editing Map

    This class consists methods to Edit Map via User Interaction and send data to the model.
    Author:
    Khashyap, drvg5 - modified class to implement Modified MVC architecture

      This method is used to Edit Map attributes like Continents, Countries and adjacency links After update, changes is saved to same text files which is loaded initially.

    • Method Detail

      • fetchMap

        public static void fetchMap(javax.swing.JDesktopPane desktop)

        This method is used to fetch text or map file from local folder to Edit User can edit Continents, Countries and adjacency links between Countries. File is already loaded in Default local folder location User can select from existing files

        Parameters:
        desktop - To bind the InternalFrame with Main window frame

      • editMap

        public void editMap(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> continentHashMap,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> continentControlValueHashMap)

        This method is used to Edit Map attributes like Continents, Countries and adjacency links After update, changes is saved to same text files which is loaded initially.

        Parameters:
        continentHashMap - Contains all attribute values
        continentControlValueHashMap - Contains Continent and its control value.

      • reloadModel

        public static void reloadModel()

        This method is used to reload Data model after changes in HashMap value.

      • findDuplicates

        public static boolean findDuplicates(java.util.List<java.lang.String> listContainingDuplicates)

        This method is used to find duplicated in Country values.

        Parameters:
        listContainingDuplicates - the list containing duplicates
        Returns:
        true, if successful

        This method is used to close the pop up window for Edit Map.
